If you love problem solving / puzzles, this game is for you.

it's a classic game with a fun, engaging story mode that makes you think hard and gives an enjoyable feeling of accomplishment when you solve a puzzle. it has funny dialog at times and interesting lore. it also comes with another free duo story mode for two people. but a great feature is it's easily accessible test chamber creator. it gives all the tools you could need (except detail options) on a simple grid to create your own fun and creative level, and you can post this level for all portal fans to see. if your bored you can enjoy a vast amount of community made test chambers (some with their own new features) and continue to enjoy this master-piece.

so much fun. kept seeing this on "best of" lists for years but honestly thought it looked kinda lame but now i know what all the fuss is about. Definitely play Portal 1 and 2 but this eclipses the original in just the volume of puzzles and variety of twists and the voicework and humor is the icing on th cake. FUN!

one of the first games you should buy on steam.
why? yes
YES. Buy it now. Go grab ur moms credit card and buy it now.

gameplay is pretty straightforward and nice just like the first game, some levels seem impossible but once you figure it out you feel like an idiot. It has tons of memorable moments and sequences such as finding the old Aperture Lab or the "This is the part where he kills you" sequence. Story wise the game is really good at too, the characters are super memorable. My only complaint is i wish there were more hidden secrets because most of them are right infront of you and pretty obvious. other than that the game is super great.

Fun game, good story, workshop support & coop but a third edition to follow is needed.
10/10. You get a potato friend. Need I say more?

New to Portal? Play Portal 1. Portal 2 assumes you played the first game already, and will throw you into complex puzzles right away.
Speaking of the puzzles, they are really clever and still confuse me even after multiple playthroughs. When you're done with the campaign however, there's still more for you to do.
I suggest playing Portal Stories: Mel, or Portal Reloaded before jumping into the puzzle editor, as these games further add onto the knowledge Portal 2 sets up, and can help you make better puzzles.

That brings me to the Puzzle Editor, Portal 2's double-edged sword. Portal 2 offers a really easy to use and readily available puzzle editor, however this means the workshop is often flooded with really simple puzzles that are further recommended due to people voting for puzzles that they can beat instead of puzzles that are clever. This results in experienced players not having as much content, and those who make new content for experienced players finding their puzzles being buried under waves of puzzles that make Portal 1 look difficult.

Look, Portal 2  is a great game. I suggest you try it, but I also suggest you take a moment to better your skills before you start making content for the game. Play community made mods, try out some of the more popular and challenging puzzles. Just please, take a moment to dive into the rabbit hole of Portal 2's mechanics before jumping into the editor. There is so much to learn, and I honestly believe it still holds up even without the rose tinted glasses.
